text: A few parts that majority would call scary, but nothing extraordinary. The story drags.
If you've seen "The Autopsy of Jane Doe" with Emile Hirsch and liked it, then give this a view. Both movies have similar vibes. I enjoyed both movies.
another generic exorcism movie

Claro, aquí tienes la versión ajustada:

It's an entertaining movie and doesn't make the big mistake of lasting two and a half hours to tell a story that could easily be explained in 90 minutes. As a horror film, it's a complete failure, but as easy-to-digest entertainment to watch with a partner, it's recommendable.
One of the best The Possession of Hannah Grace Comedy Horror Thriller Comedy & Mystery Comedy Funny Parody Wrestling Movie Love True Blood Like It Awkward. Teen Wolf 5 out of 5💯⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

Some bits were a bit over the top, but that's to be expected in a possession horror.  The atmosphere of isolation combined with the jump scares nicely.  I always try to wait til the end of the run and go first thing on a Sunday, so I get the theater as near to myself as possible; this movie made me regret that decision. Not the best, sure, but in no way the worst.

I can comfortably say that The Possession of Hannah Grace is one of the worst horror movies I’ve seen in a long time—it's not even in the same league as Thankskilling 3. The plot is painfully simple, and at times, the CGI is hard to watch. With such a straightforward storyline, I found myself bored, as only the last 20 minutes of the film truly deliver any horror, which feels like a stretch. The acting is the best part, especially from the main cast, but the film fails to handle the subject of PTSD realistically, overly dramatizing it in a way that doesn’t resonate. I wouldn't recommend wasting your time on this one.

I enjoyed it. It was a unique angle on a possession story. I liked the atmospheric slow build. They could have done more with the environment but I wasn't too upset. Honestly the lack of chemistry/energy between the characters was the biggest drawback.

Fairly decent movie, simple plot, well acted, the cinematography was excellent. Some of the CGI was less than desired, but overall, a little better than some of the the usual demonic possession type films out there.

“The Possession of Hannah Grace” ist ein US-amerikanischer Horrorfilm von Regisseur Diederik Van Rooijen. … Als eine Polizistin aus der Entzugsklinik entlassen wird, arbeitet sie in einem Leichenschauhaus. Dort passiert eine Reihe von schrecklichen Dingen. Diese Dinge kommen von einer schrecklichen Leiche … Ein anständiger Gruselfilm, der jedoch sehr unoriginell ist. Stellen Sie sich vor, der Lazarus-Effekt trifft auf The Autopsy Of Jane Doe. …

Well acted, lighting and cinematography were good, but it’s a slow build to no where that leaves you rolling your eyes at the all to obvious underlying themes. It deals with PTSD, addiction, and personal growth in a way that feels like being beaten with a baseball bat covered in foam…. A slow, torturous slog.
Such a linear story which left nothing to the imagination.  Don't bother.

Admittedly this is pretty unoriginal but I actually enjoyed it because it has a great tone and atmosphere. It reminded me of The Exorcism of Emily Rose (2005) but it’s a much more entertaining film. There are some great set-pieces. It’s a well-made production. The acting is good. The characters are a bit dull and forgettable. So it’s not memorable or bad. I really don’t have much to say but it’s a good forgettable horror.

Just a slow build up to nothing. Alot of repetitiveness. Relying on the 'body-horror' genre, without actually doing a good job. Great lighting and cinematography, generic actors. But overall, not worth the watch.

Having just watched this film, I'm too frightened to go to sleep. Can't believe how low this film has scored. It was a creepy tense horror, brilliant effects, good suspense, well acted, and the morgue setting is exceptional. In fact, i can't recall a better horror setting for a sense of isolation and dread since the overlook hotel.  Who needs complex characters in a horror anyway. Go watch remains if the day if you need that.

I have to be honest; after people on social media hyping me up for this movie I was so excited to finally watch it. Now that I have, I do feel quite underwhelmed. This feels as though ChatGPT was asked to create a script for a horror movie featuring the possession of a young girl. Although there are a few scary scenes, the storyline in itself, especially the climax of the plot, left a lot to wish for. So, while this movie was not terrible, I will probably not be watching it again.

In a word: blah. I thought it started off pretty great. You had this struggling main character, in a cold, dark and grey environment, surrounded by dead people and stuck with a demon. And then it starts to get a bit...frantic? Scrambled? Like the movie was running out of time, and tried to rush stuff Started off promising, but ultimately came out an unsatisfying product.
Very creepy! I dont know why its rated so low here.

In essence, Hannah Grace will be one of the lower-ranked films among possession-themed movies. Although it excels in technical aspects and acting, its failure to establish a solid content framework prevents it from being a memorable production. In a horror film, fear must be appropriately present, and Hannah Grace fails to achieve this satisfactorily. You can try it when seeking foreign horror films in the cinema, but I advise against having high expectations.

Peppered with clichés, predictable jump-scares and horror elements, no depth in story and characters. No logical, comprehensible exchange of the individual characters. Desperate attempt to scare the viewer. Please skip this film.
